faqs.question: What are the best sports betting apps?
faqs.answerFocus: FanDuel, BetMGM, and Bet365 rank highest based on App Store ratings, user reviews, and feature sets. FanDuel excels with parlay builder, BetMGM offers MGM Rewards, Bet365 provides extensive international markets.

faqs.question: Are sports betting apps legal in California?
faqs.answerFocus: No, sports betting apps are not legal in California. Propositions 26 and 27 failed in November 2022. No timeline for legalization.

faqs.question: What sports betting apps are 18+?
faqs.answerFocus: Only 5 states allow 18+: Montana, New Hampshire, Rhode Island, Wyoming, DC. All major apps (FanDuel, DraftKings, BetMGM, etc.) operate at 18+ in these states. Elsewhere 21+ required.

faqs.question: What sports betting apps are legal in Missouri?
faqs.keyword: what sports betting apps are legal in missouri
faqs.answerFocus: Missouri legalized sports betting November 2024. Available apps: FanDuel, DraftKings, BetMGM, Caesars, and others launching in 2025. 21+ age requirement.

faqs.question: Are sports betting apps available in Colorado?
faqs.answerFocus: Yes, sports betting apps legal in Colorado since May 2020. All 10 featured apps available: FanDuel, BetMGM, Bet365, DraftKings, etc. 21+ requirement.

faqs.question: Are sports betting apps legal in Maine?
faqs.answerFocus: Yes, sports betting apps legal in Maine since November 2023. Available apps: DraftKings, Caesars, Fanatics. 21+ age requirement.

faqs.question: Are sports betting apps legal?
faqs.answerFocus: Sports betting apps are legal in 38+ US states. Legality depends on your state. Apps legal in NY, NJ, PA, CO, and more. Always check state regulations.

faqs.question: Can 20 year olds use sports betting apps?
faqs.keyword: sports betting apps for 20 year olds
faqs.answerFocus: No, 20 year olds cannot use sports betting apps in most states. Minimum age is 21+ in most legal states. Only MT, NH, RI, WY, DC allow 18+.

faqs.question: Which betting app has the best odds?
faqs.answerFocus: BetMGM and Caesars typically offer most competitive odds among betting apps. FanDuel and DraftKings also competitive. Odds vary by sport and market.

faqs.question: Which sports betting app has the fastest payouts?
faqs.answerFocus: FanDuel and BetMGM offer fastest payouts, typically within 24 hours via PayPal/Venmo. Caesars and DraftKings also fast. Payment method impacts speed.

faqs.question: Do I need a promo code for betting apps?
faqs.answerFocus: Most betting apps auto-apply welcome bonuses via promotional links. Some apps like Caesars and Fanatics may require promo codes. Check each app's current offer.

faqs.question: What is the best NFL betting app?
faqs.answerFocus: FanDuel is best NFL betting app due to same game parlay builder, extensive player props, and live betting interface. DraftKings and BetMGM also excellent for NFL.

tier1: App Store reviews and ratings - must cite version, rating (X/5 stars), review count (X reviews), and date range analyzed
Google Play reviews and ratings - must cite rating and review count
Reddit (r/sportsbook, r/sportsbetting) - cite specific threads when quoting user opinions
State gambling commission websites for legal information
tier2: Brand official sites - features verification ONLY (not for pros/cons)
App store screenshots for UI/UX analysis
forbidden: NEVER use affiliate sites (ActionNetwork, Covers, TheLines) for pros/cons or editorial opinions
NEVER use reviews older than 6 months
NEVER cite vague sources ('many users say', 'experts agree')

brands.name: Bet365
brands.rationale: Highest branded search volume (59K/mo), dominant international brand, superior app technology

brands.name: DraftKings
brands.rationale: 5,300/mo branded searches, market leader, innovative parlay features, DFS integration

brands.name: theScore BET
brands.rationale: Formerly ESPN BET (rebranded Dec 2025), media-integrated experience, newsworthy evolution

brands.name: Caesars
brands.rationale: 800/mo branded searches, established casino brand, Caesars Rewards integration

brands.name: Fanatics
brands.rationale: 400/mo searches, fast-growing newcomer, unique merchandise rewards

brands.name: BetRivers
brands.rationale: 900/mo branded searches, strong regional presence, iRush Rewards

brands.name: Hard Rock Bet
brands.rationale: 1,200/mo searches, growing brand awareness, Unity Rewards, casino integration

brands.name: Borgata
brands.rationale: Strong regional presence NJ/PA, MGM-owned, casino crossover appeal

compliance.ageRequirement: 21+ in most states (18+ in MT, NH, RI, WY, DC)
compliance.affiliateDisclosure: Required in intro (50-75 words): Explain commission relationship, maintain editorial independence
compliance.responsibleGambling: Required section at bottom (150 words): Resources, hotline, self-exclusion tools
compliance.noDatedLanguage: Use 'Last Updated: December 2025' badge, NOT dates in H1 or titles
compliance.theScoreBETRebrand: Always mention 'formerly ESPN BET' on first reference (rebranded December 2025)
